i would label this sentence a [4] very relevant in determining what is right and wrong.

the emotional well-being of individuals is an important consideration when evaluating the morality of an action. if someone has suffered emotionally as a result of an action, it suggests that the action may have been harmful or unjust, which can be an indicator of wrongdoing. conversely, if an action promotes emotional well-being and happiness, it may be considered morally right.
